title: Spectator Out Loud: Douglas Murray, Mary Wakefield and Nicola Shulman
description: On this episode of Spectator Out Loud, Douglas Murray starts by explaining why C. S. Lewis was right about war. (00:56) Mary Wakefield is up next, looking at the founding myth that Russia and Ukraine are fighting over. (10:18) Nicola Shulman finishes the podcast, reading her piece about Philip Larkin's big problem. (16:53)
itunes:author: The Spectator
dc:creator: The Spectator
